column4: is there a way to DL all the packages for 8.1 ? I'm heading for the land of no internet
erm yes all..
That's a lot of data.
better a lot than none
Still, you want to download every single package from the repositories?
It would take more than a few min to explain why but yes
I really don't recommend doing this, but you can do sudo apt-get install * to install them. mind you, this is several gigabytes of data, and not all packages will be useful for you. o_O
Godspeed if you do.
that is the crux of the issue I don't need all the pkgs but need to have them availible
I just need to dl thewhole thing
In that case, sudo aptitude download *
that easy ?
yup
But are you sure you have the room for it?
this from an old BSD usr that had to deal w/ slo or no internet for months
still, this is terabytes of data we're talking about
TB I got connection I don't
heh
Good luck with it, kop
it's this or thumb drive by RFC1149
I'll save you the search and thanx for the help http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc1149.html
I am well aware of RFC 1149 :)
more than happy to bring back an old memory but how about something more useful ? http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=352460
I'm still rtfm atm but I may have answered my own question
